title: How climbing works, and what you can do.
body:
Probably gonna be a bit different to your generic post on this, but it'll have a lot of the same.

1) Focus on getting better at the game, not climbing

Fact is, Getting better at the game causes you to climb as a consequence, climbing 80-90 LP doesn't really mean much, as you could easily lose that the next day, but if you get better at the game, you'll climb regardless of variance rather then only climbing based on variance (this variance can be anything between the rest of your team, to just your team comp vs theirs.)

2) Small sample sizes mean nothing.

If your asking for help, don't come in with a 50% win rate over the last 20 games and expect to not be told that your needing more to climb, a random 50% win rate will never be good enough, here is an example of my climb to gold in S5

https://image.prntscr.com/image/McyhAX0oQPKZl_wPRBpbhA.png

You'll notice it's not just one champ randomly having good stats, it's all my champions having good stats, good KDA's without giving up win rates (one thing you have to understand is that a good KDA means nothing if you lose)

3) Work out your player type

Now we always read on here to "narrow down your champion pool" and while that works for some people, it doesn't work for all of them, i know i myself need a slightly larger pool or i easily burn out, find what is best for you, work out the champs that your actually good on (be objective about it, don't just consider win rate) and get better on the champs your good with, this isn't always about dropping your pool down to 1/2 champions, some people can easily have 4-8 champions and still have the same effect, but find champs with similar enough play styles.

4) Learn every role.

Auto fill is a thing.

If you just learn the basics of every role, you'll do better in these off games, find just one champ that does you well in each of the other roles (for example, i for ages had thresh support as my off role pick that i can just play whenever i get support)

5) Macro > Micro

While your Micro mechanics (like laning) can win you lane, you still need to know what to be doing in the Macro cross map game.

Know when to ping your team back, and know when you should be getting the next turret that is being pushed instead of shoving into nexus towers.

This however doesn't mean ditch your team, A shit play that has the team together is better then a good play that doesn't have enough people doing it.

6) Focus on the CS, forget trading.

If your low ELO (Bronze, low silver) focus more on the last hitting then the trading, believe it or not, but that gold on the CS could actually help you climb, simply just having 30-80 CS up on your opponent consistently, whether there has been kills or not, means extra items/parts over them.

Then when mid game comes around, you can start focusing more on the trading and the teamfighting with that advantage in your pocket.

7) Watch streamers who do your main role.

This isn't for the entertainment, this is for routing, (jungle) lane management, and runes.

Know what is meta and what isn't, and try and learn how they would win in matchups against certain champions.

And believe it or not, their runes are better then yours, every time (though maybe don't copy stopwatch if your Bronze/silver, your actually going to kill yourself more then help yourself with that.).

replies.body: I know we disagree on pretty much everything but this is some pretty solid advice dude.

it's always good to get a reminder in such a concise and impactfully written form though. I've recently been tilted because I'm very rusty at league, and bleeding out mmr and lp like mad. Just today I tried to play very aggressive with janna, but was never getting any follow up for my picks, and these weren't necessarily bad picks, this wasn't my team's fault either, but this was my fault because I expected them to make too many big plays without earning their confidence with a high winrate this season. Sure I might be trying to make a big play, but should they have any confidence in a guy that is currently declining at an alarming rate?
Let's say i've done all this and still keep falling. What at this point?

TBH this is more aimed at Pre-gold.

But my main suggestion for you would be stop playing top lane, top lane is in a horrid place right now, where you can't really carry the game, and the game is essentially decided by the other 4 in the game.
I might aswell be at pre gold with the amount of times i've gone up 50 points and then instantly fallen back down. Should honestly get demoted with all that god damn falling.

I mean, your constantly Gold 1/2 for years, so you are probably in the place you should be as much as that sucks.

But yeah top lane, not a place to climb at all, your basically relying on your bot/mid to not int, and one side's will int.
I can understand that yeah of being gold 1/2 but...you know currently im literally teeting off being demoted to silver and gold 0. like wtf

Probably start with watching your replays and finding something you aren't so great with, like map awareness or rotating etc. You'll notice your mistakes a lot easier looking back on the replay then you will in the heat of the moment. Find a thing you're not so hot at, and work on it till it's better, rinse and repeat :)

That said, different things work for different people, but once you find what works for you and you can see is making an improvement, stick with it.
